Card_1.description: Your sister confides in you about how tough she is finding it to fund your niece's extracurriculars. Do you offer to pitch in and help your niece continue her sports or let her drop out?

Card_2.description: Your office has offered you a free matching contribution of $100 if you contribute towards a retirement fund. The only catch is, you have to do it monthly, and you can't touch it till you retire.

Card_3.description: Your friends are planning the trip of a lifetime before all of you get settled into more domestic lives. The plan is to spend a month in Europe, from the verdant forests of Switzerland to the romantic gondolas of Venice, with a grand finale in posh Paris.

Card_4.description: Your hair needs grooming regularly to look professional. You can either opt to do it at home (which is quite a hassle), or get a monthly salon pass, and let the professionals handle it all.

Card_5.description: The limited edition crocery set you always dreamt of has just come on the market, and it costs an arm and a leg, as it should. You don't have the money right now, but can save for a few months to get there. Your brand new house deserves the lovely crocery!

Card_6.description: Your parents just bought a new TV and have offered to sell their old one to you for peanuts. On the other hand, you've always wanted the new smart TV on the market, which has great picture and sound quality, and lasts for years son end,  but to buy which you will have to take out a loan.
Card_6.option_1: Old TV and invest $200/month for 3 months

Card_7.description: Your financial planner has advised you to put aside at least a $1000 to cover medical emergencies. You can pay $50 for 20 months, or $100 for just 9!

Card_8.description: Oops. A trekking expedition with friends has led to your socks developing random holes. Sure, no one can see them through your shoes, but it does impact your own sense of style.

Card_9.description: An emergency medical situation has led to your parents are facing a financial crunch. They've asked for a little help for a few months to tide them over.

Card_10.description: Your neighbour's teenager, in a bout of angst, scratches your brand new car. The paint will have to be completely redone. Alternatively, you can tape it up for now, making your car the ugliest one on the block.

Card_11.description: Your old school has just offered you a position as a substitute warden for the children's Disneyland trip. It clashes with your plans of visiting Africa, which has been a lifelong dream, but at least you get an amazing vacation at a huge discount. The only con is that you will have to be the reponsible adult looking after 20 teenagers there.
Card_11.option_2: Save for the trip $100/month for 6 months

Card_12.description: Your lovely new house is missing some plants, and you've always wanted a home garden. You can get the seeds you want for free at the corner discount store, or you can get the fancy, organic ones that basically do everything but water themselves.

Card_13.description: Autumn is coming up, and that means a wardrobe update! Out with the summery florals and in with the mauves and maroons. You can get the high-street brands that fit you like a glove, or get some second-hand clothes from your friends and tailor them to your liking.

Card_14.description: Your brother finally popped the question to his long-time girlfriend. You want to do something special for the betrothed couple. Unfortunately, the gift you had in mind costs a bomb, which you can ill afford at this time. Do you still go ahead, or leave it for later?

Card_15.description: Your friend needs some money desperately for his start-up. He has promised to return 1.5x the money in 3 days, and you know it's almost certain money since he already has pending orders to fulfil. The only catch is that he needs the money immediately.

Card_16.description: The beautiful islands of Haiti have been devastated by an earthquake. To get the tourism industry back on its feet, the government is offering huge concessions to tourists, making it a perfect time for you to visit as well as give back to the local businesses.

Card_17.description: There is some seepage in your new roof which has caused the paint in your living room to peel off. You can get it painted afresh lime green, keeping with the latest trend, or you can leave it as it is. After all, it isn't harming anyone, and no one visits your house anyway.
Card_17.option_2: Leave it as is and invest $70

Card_18.description: Given the amount you drive your new car, it is a miracle that your tires aren't bald yet from all the friction. Irrespective, it is high time you get them changed before you cause an accident. You can get the basic replacement, which is free with your maintenance contract, or you can splurge for the more expensive ones, which last twice as long.

Card_19.description: Ta-da! It is your grandpa's birthday, and you want to take him out to Disneyland to celebrate the kid he is at heart. However, he cannot wait in line, so you need to buy the premium pass. Or you can simply wish him and be done with it.

Card_20.description: Your brother asks you to loan him a few dollars till his next paycheck hits. He'll pay you a bit extra for the effort, but he isn't exactly a stickler for money.

Card_21.description: Since you plan to explore at least three countries in the next year, you are tempted to buy a loyalty card for your favorite airlines. It will give you cheaper tickets, free upgrades, and access to their lounges - all ingredients for the perfect vacation!

Card_22.description: All the gardening in your house's tiny little garden has led to a horribly cramped back. You have an ointment at home which will do perfectly fine - but you could also get an amazing massage from a professional masseuse.

Card_23.description: Since becoming a home-owner, you have developed a sudden interest in baking. The microwave oven in your kitchen is no longer cutting it. Do you open your wallet for the cutting-edge OTG baker's delight, or make do with what you have?

Card_24.description: Your Home Owner's Association has decided to levy a fee of $50 per month per car, to curb kerbside parking. Do you cough up the money to ensure safe parking, or chance it with parking on adjacent roads?
Card_24.option_2: Unsafe parking and invest $50/month for 6 months

Card_25.description: The fumes from the traffic in your congested neighbourhood have lead to a chronic cough for you. You need to get it treated from a specialist.

Card_26.description: Uh-oh. Your car needs a new radiator (already!). If you had splurged for the higher-end one, you might have received this service for free, but now it is going to have to be out-of-pocket.

Card_27.description: The latest molecular gastronomy cafe in town has a fancy five-course meal which you've been salivating about. Your friends can't afford it, but agree to accompany you if you pay for everyone.

Card_28.description: Your favourite author is coming to your local book store for exclusive signed copies of her latest bestseller.

Card_29.description: The holidays are coming up and your favourite club is holding a masquerade party. Unfortunately, you need to pay to enter as a singleton.

Card_30.description: Your friend asks you to go along to the food truck across your office for lunch, but you prefer the sit-down ristorante nearby.

Card_31.description: You've spotted what, to you, seems like the next big thing in modernist art. The only problem is, she thinks so too, and is asking for a good sum.

Card_32.description: Your boss has invited you to a cruise dinner-and-DJ. Not only is it a good career move to accept, but also, the party will be absolutely rocking.

Card_33.description: You've recently started cooking at home, which is when you realised that the more expensive oil is not only healthier, but also delicious.

Card_34.description: The Metropolitan Museum has an annual pass, which is basically a steal for you, given how many times you visit and spend hours there.

Card_35.description: Your childhood friend's baby shower is to be planned. A cheaper option is to hold it in the public garden, but you are leaning towards the country club - pricey but classy.

Card_36.description: Your pantry needs to be refilled, and the choice is between getting your supplies from the discount supermarket, or the organic niche farmer's market.

Card_37.description: At an art auction, you bid for a work by an up-and-coming artist. The latest bid is slightly above your budget but you love the piece.

Card_38.description: Tickets for a concert by your college-time favourite band are being pre-sold for a premium - but you're assured of a seat!

Card_39.description: Your phone has conked off - again - and you need to get a new one. The local store sells a basic model for cheap, which will suffice for your use. But, you've had your eye on the latest i-model out there.

Card_40.description: Your new house could really do with a sound system, given all the parties you hold there.

Card_41.description: With all the time you've been spending at home, a home theatre sounds like a good investment.

Card_42.description: Your childhood home is on the verge of being sold by the bank because of your parents' inability to pay their debt. You can save it - for now - and your parents promise they'll do better.

Card_43.description: Your skin needs a particular lip balm from Paris to weather the harsh winter. Usually its available online, but this time you will have to order it from the store directly - for full price.

Card_44.description: You've always dreamt of bungee-jumping, and your local guides are now offering it at the hill ranges nearby. However, they don't quite make for Instagram-worthy pics like the ones abroad.

Card_45.description: Your friends have decided to travel cross-country, utilizing the extensive rail network across. However, you think it's a great opportunity to get your new wheels spinning.

Card_46.description: The holidays are coming up, and your Christmas decoration is too old to be put up in your brand new spanking house. But the stores always jack up their prices around this timeï¿½

Card_47.description: Holiday season brings out the glutton in you! Store-bought turkey, dry as it is, or the farm-grown organically-fed and humanely-killed ones, which make you salivate just thinking about them?

Card_48.description: Your neighbourhood association has organized hobby classes, and you've always fancied yourself an amateur potter.

Card_49.description: You've gained quite a reputation for organizing great parties, and your colleagues have requested you to host one for your boss' farewell. It would be a good gesture for a woman who's mentored all of you.

Card_50.description: Health is important and you think you need to monitor it. Having a swanky Fitbit will also not hurt your style quotient - but will certainly hurt your wallet.

Card_51.description: The winter has truly arrived and you need a new jacket. Your mom has offered you her old one that she's grown out of, but you've had your eye on the Chanel one in the store by your office, and it's on discount now.

Card_52.description: Holiday gifting is your speciality and all your nieces and nephews look forward to opening your gifts. You have so many brilliant ideas - but unfortunately they cost big bucks. Or you can buy cute toys from the dollar store.

Card_53.description: Yay! Your sister has just given birth and has requested you to come help her for a month in Egypt. She will pay for your flights. While you're at it, you can also explore north Africa; at your own expense, of course.

Card_54.description: A fancy car-detailing store has come up in your neighbourhood mall, and your new car could use some lighting and accents.

Card_55.description: The cold weather has made you realize the importance of good flooring. You could go for some carpets lying unused in the basement, or you could splurge for heated floors all around.

Card_56.description: A sudden influx of house-guests means that you need to stock up your fridge with drinks. You could make some lemonade at home, or you could get the boujee flavored waters from the store.

Card_57.description: Your country club has organized a lunch for young members, along with a fun Bingo night. You could go only for the free lunch, but you do feel lucky nowadays.

Card_58.description: A string of burglaries in your neighbourhood has made you want to invest more in security. You could buy the smart home security setups which all but arrest the miscreants, or you can depend on your cat to scare them away.

Card_59.description: Self-care is all about indulging your creativity, and you need paints for it. Sure, you have some, but they are old and dull, not shiny and glittery like the ones at the hobby store.

Card_60.description: An NFT issued by your favourite singer is on the market, for not that much of a premium. You don't know if you can sell it for a profit, but honestly, you wouldn't want to anyway.
